data.title: Official Website for the HBO Series
data.meta_description: The official website for The Wire on HBO, featuring interviews, schedule information, behind the scenes exclusives, and more.
data.text:
PEABODY AWARD WINNER, NOMINATED FOR 2 EMMY AWARDS

The Wire

5 Seasons | 60 Episodes | TV-MA

WATCH NOWMAX

Follow a single sprawling drug and murder investigation in Baltimore from the perspective of cops and criminals in this classic series.

Featured Characters

James "Jimmy" McNulty

Dominic West

William Bunk Moreland

Wendell Pierce

Shakima "Kima" Greggs

Sonja Sohn

Lester Freamon

Clarke Peters

Omar Little

Michael K. Williams

Celebrating 20 Years of The Wire

Most Iconic Lines

Take your notebooks out, because The Wire is here to give us all some of the deepest and realest quotes that have ever been delivered on screen.

Watch on YouTube

20th Anniversary Instagram Filter

Take a selfie and celebrate with your favorite The Wire quote.

The Wire at 20 Official Podcast

In honor of its 20th anniversary, HBO is releasing a brand new podcast hosted by musician and actor Method Man, featuring revealing interviews and looking back at David Simon’s sprawling five-season drama and unpacking its ongoing legacy.

1966-2021

Remembering Michael K. Williams

Michael Kenneth Williams was an extraordinary artist, adept at bringing characters like Omar Little, Chalky White, and Montrose Freeman into vivid color. A beloved member of the HBO family for more than 20 years, Williams is remembered not only as an immensely talented actor, but as a civil justice advocate. He will be profoundly missed.

It's All Here

Sign Up Now

The Cast Remembers the Show’s Legacy

The series meant as much to them as it does to you. Sonja Sohn, Wendell Pierce, and more offer insight.

Read More

1 . The Target

Baltimore detective Jimmy McNulty gets assigned to a new task force.

2 . The Detail

McNulty feels the heat when a witness who testified against D'Angelo is killed.

3 . The Buys

The early-morning 'field interviews' by Herc, Carver and Prez result in a minor riot.

4 . Old Cases

Greggs and McNulty try to get Hardcase to turn informant as arraignment begins for those caught in the raid.

5 . The Pager

McNulty's detail finally gets 'clone' pagers to track Barksdale and his gang, but nobody can crack the codes used by the callers.

6 . The Wire

McNulty and Greggs ask for a delay in a murder bust in order to preserve the wiretap.

7 . One Arrest

Tipped off by the wire, Greggs, Herc, Carver and Freamon make a bust, but the incident makes Avon and Stringer suspicious.

8 . Lessons

An unlikely source gives McNulty the tag of Stringer Bell's car. Later, Omar earns his 'loose cannon' reputation.

9 . Game Day

Barksdale plays an expensive game of one-upmanship with an east-side rival.

10 . The Cost

With Wallace in custody, McNulty and Daniels must figure out what to do with him in the time before he testifies.

11 . The Hunt

Burrell orders Daniels to hit dealers for results that will impress the media. Meanwhile, Greggs is in the ICU.

12 . Cleaning Up

With the detail's future hanging in the balance, Daniels faces off against Burrell and his political allies.

13 . Sentencing

Daniels and McNulty turn to a higher authority to crack the case.

Ebb Tide

Det. Jimmy McNulty--exiled to police-boat duty--makes a shocking discovery in the Baltimore harbor.

Collateral Damage

Major Valchek gets back at Sobotka for the church gift fiasco, and a feud begins.

Hot Shots

Bunk and Freamon chase their crime scene, a container ship, to Philly.

Hard Cases

Sobotka reprimands his nephew Nick for stealing the cameras and orders him to bring the cargo back.

Undertow

Ziggy loses his prized Camaro to drug dealers who aren't buying his alibis about not paying up.

All Prologue

Trying to let go of police work and return to his marriage, McNulty gives up on identifying his Jane Doe.

Backwash

Russell tells Sobotka the investigation is over, but a computer is cloned, and when a container goes missing, the cops follow.

Duck and Cover

McNulty is back to his old self, on a drunken binge of legendary proportions.

Stray Rounds

Bodie's effort to improve sales ends disastrously, forcing Bell to rethink his strategy.

Storm Warnings

Bodie is unhappy that Proposition Joe's people are slinging on his turf.

Bad Dreams

With the clock ticking, the Detail makes a desperate move, and Daniels reams out Landsman for dropping the ball.

Port in a Storm

The Detail has a setback, and needs a new cooperator, while Russell and Bunk revisit Philly, looking for evidence.

Time After Time

In the Season Three premiere, a wave of urban reform brings down the notorious Franklin Terrace public housing towers.

All Due Respect

Omar continues his bold strikes on Barksdale stash houses, which are now heavily guarded.

Dead Soldiers

Colvin feels the sting of Burrell and Rawls during a Comstat assessment of his district's felony numbers.

Amsterdam

West Baltimore residents get some surprising straight talk at a community meeting from Major Colvin.

Straight and True

Frustrated in his reform efforts, Colvin delivers a message to the next level of corner management.

Homecoming

Stringer Bell gets an education in construction management; Bunk uses shoe-leather to catch up with Omar.

Back Burners

Herc discovers a blast from the past, which he belatedly reveals to his ex-colleagues.

Moral Midgetry

With Amsterdam running full-tilt, Carver and Truck discover there really is no honor among thieves.

Slapstick

Responding to an officer's call for help, McNulty and Prez turn down the wrong alley, with unanticipated results.

Reformation

Brother Mouzone returns to Baltimore on a mission of revenge and casts a wide net in his search for Omar.

Middle Ground

The wire begins to yield information about the Barksdale organization, though links to the top are elusive.

Mission Accomplished

A reticent Avon readies his troops for a seemingly endless war against Marlo.

Boys of Summer

Four boys from West Baltimore play out their summer vacation; Royce and Carcetti hit the campaign trail.

Soft Eyes

Pearlman treads on thin ice; Marlo plays Robin Hood; Prez preps for school; Carcetti drops a bombshell on Royce.

Home Rooms

Royce resorts to extreme measures; the detail gets a new boss and agenda; Prez survives his first day at school.

Refugees

A high-profile homicide case gets a new detective; Marlo gets burned in poker; Colvin and Cutty get new jobs in the school system.

Alliances

Burrell feels the heat from Royce; Marlo tries to enlist Michael; Dukie debunks Randy's "special dead" theory.

Margin Of Error

Carcetti responds to a campaign smear; Randy makes a startling revelation; Marlo proves elusive.

Unto Others

Royce and Carcetti make their peace; Prez has a good day; Greggs uses 'soft eyes' at a crime scene.

Corner Boys

Carcetti makes the rounds; Colvin uses corner logic in class; Daniels sees his stock rising; Michael is unsettled by an unwanted guest.

Know Your Place

Bubbles fingers a witness for Herc; Colvin offers an incentive; Andre turns to Proposition Joe for protection.

Misgivings

Burrell sends out a mandate; Kevin comes clean to Marlo; Bubbles gets payback; Chris takes care of a problem.

A New Day

Carcetti faces a dilemma; Randy gets the cold shoulder; Omar makes a power play; Freamon has a revelation.

That's Got His Own

Freamon seeks help in City Hall; Bubbles turns desperate; Michael rejects his past; and Omar strikes again.

Final Grades

Namond, Randy and Dukie adjust to new realities; Michael is promoted; Omar makes Prop Joe a new offer; McNulty looks to pay back a debt.

More With Less

Budget cuts hit the police hard. Meanwhile, corporate downsizing frustrates the staff of a local newspaper.

Unconfirmed Reports

McNulty decides to take matters into his own hands; Marlo takes care of unfinished business.

Not For Attribution

Carcetti's police plans are leaked to the press; Marlo cleans up his cash; McNulty shares his obsession with Freamon.

Transitions

The police brass changes; McNulty and Freamon look for bodies; Prop Joe pays his last respects; Marlo delivers a gift.

React Quotes

Marlo's new alliance gives Freamon and McNulty a fresh lead; the press turns its attention to a breaking story, to Davis' relief.

The Dickensian Aspect

Templeton makes headlines; Bunk follows up on old leads; McNulty takes an interest in the homeless.

Took

An unexpected call puts Templeton and the newspaper back in the spotlight--and gets McNulty some unwanted extra attention.

Clarifications

Bunk returns a McNulty favor; Carcetti is forced to make political deals; Hayes talks to Templeton about his sources.

Late Editions

Freamon's hard work pays off with a promising lead, though McNulty isn't in the mood to celebrate.

-30-

McNulty and Freamon face the consequences of their actions, while Carcetti tries to save face.

AVAILABLE NOW

We Own This City

Executive produced by George Pelecanos and David Simon -- and based on the book by Baltimore Sun reporter Justin Fenton -- We Own This City is a six-hour, limited series chronicling the rise and fall of the Baltimore Police Department's Gun Trace Task Force.

FIND OUT MORE

You May Also Like
